section.title: integrate function
section.para: Returns the numeric integral of the first argument from the second to the third argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The integrate function returns the numeric integral of f from a to b. This is mathematically written as:
This integral is the same as the area between the function f and the x-axis from a to b where the area under the axis is counted negative. f may be any function with x as variable if the function is used in a standard function and t as variable if it is a parametric function. a and b may be any numeric expressions that evaluate to real numbers. integrate does not calculate the integral exactly. Instead the calculation is done using Simpson's formula through 100 iterations.

section.title: fact function
section.para: Returns the factorial of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The fact function returns the factorial of n, commonly written as n!. n may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a positive integer. The function is defined as fact(n)=n(n-1)(n-2)...1, and relates to the gamma function as fact(n)=gamma(n+1).

section.title: gamma function
section.para: Returns the value of the Euler gamma function of the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para:
The gamma function returns the result of the Euler gamma function of z, commonly written as Γ(z). z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. section.title: beta function
section.para: Returns the value of the Euler beta function evaluated for the arguments.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The beta function returns the result of the Euler beta function evaluated for m and n. m and n may be any numeric expressions that evaluate to real numbers or complex numbers. The beta function relates to the gamma function as beta(m, n) = gamma(m) * gamma(n) / gamma(m+n).

section.title: W function
section.para: Returns the value of the Lambert W-function evaluated for the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The W function returns the result of the Lambert W-function, also known as the omega function, evaluated for z. z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number. The inverse of the W function is given by f(W)=W*eW.

simplesect.title: Remarks
simplesect.para: For real values of z when z < -1/e, the W function will evaluate to values with an imaginary part.

section.title: zeta function
section.para: Returns the value of the Riemann Zeta function evaluated for the argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The zeta function returns the result of the Riemann Zeta function, commonly written as ζ(s). z may be any numeric expression that evaluates to a real number or a complex number.

simplesect.title: Remarks
simplesect.para: The zeta function is defined for the whole complex plane except for the pole at z=1.

section.title: mod function
section.para: Returns the remainder of the first argument divided by the second argument.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: Calculates m modulo n, the remainder of m/n. mod calculates the remainder f, where m = a*n + f for some integer a. The sign of f is always the same as the sign of n. When n=0, mod returns 0. m and n may be any numeric expressions that evaluate to real numbers.

section.title: dnorm function
section.para: Returns the normal distribution of the first argument with optional mean value and standard deviation.

simplesect.title: Description
simplesect.para: The dnorm function is the probability density of the normal distribution, also called Gaussian distribution. x is the variate, μ is the mean value and σ is the standard deviation. μ and σ are optional and if left out the standard normal distribution is used where μ=0 and σ=1. x, μ and σ may be any numeric expressions that evaluate to real numbers where σ > 0.
